snippet: Hamilton’s bid for the Formula One championship got a boost when Ferrari decided to put new engines in its cars at the Grand Prix in Austin, Tex., prompting a 10-spot penalty for Sebastian Vettel on the starting grid.
abstract: Driver Sebastian Vettel gets 10-spot penalty when Ferrari swaps engines for fifth time at United States Grand Prix, giving Lewis Hamilton boost in race for Formula One championship.
lead_paragraph: Hamilton’s bid for the Formula One championship got a boost when Ferrari decided to put new engines in its cars at the Grand Prix in Austin, Tex., prompting a 10-spot penalty for Sebastian Vettel on the starting grid.
